reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic. Extremely good value, clean & tidy, lovely food (breakfast was especially good), lovely big car park, nice big twin room and all the staff were friendly and cheerful (especially Charlotte in the restaurant, the barmen and the receptionists).
reviews.title: I highly recommend this hotel!!

reviews.text: I stayed here with my son in a twin room for 2 nights so that we could visit Edinburgh over the August bank holiday weekend. Its quiet and my car was nice and safe.
reviews.title: A bit far from Edinburg

reviews.text: The only teeny weeny downside was the room was quite warm as there's no air con and the windows don't open very much (obviously for security/safety reasons) but thanks to the rubbish British summer it didn't actually matter.
reviews.title: Breakfast EXTRA

reviews.text: By the way, it cost the same to park in Edinburgh as it would have for 2 of us to go on the train from Livingston North station.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: A nice hotel with friendly and helpfull staff. With very good and new shoping facilities and "factory" outlet, surprisingly closing at 17:00 but within walking distance. Hotel has 2 floors and no lift. Wifi only in loby. From Edinburg its 4 stops with train + a cab ride. Bus is not a good idea, as it took 1,5 hour.
reviews.title: Great stay in Livingstone

reviews.text: We've stayed at this lovely hotel quite a few times and every time we return the staff remember us! We travel from Sunderland to visit our family who live in Livingston, fantastic hotel, rooms really nice very comfortable and clean, this hotel has a pool and gym which our grandchildren loved( the pool!!!) staff are really friendly and helpfully, the choice of food in the restaurant is excellent and the breakfasts are just the best!! Look out for special deals at this hotel they do some fantastic deals! but be quick they go fast!! Looking forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: Made welcome

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night during the last week in August. The staff on reception were very pleasant & helpful, the room was clean and comfortable but hot & stuffy overnight. We were at the back of the hotel & when we opened the window to cool the room down the loud humming sound of a generator(?) kept us awake so we had to close the window again. That aside it was a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Good value, pleasant atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in hotel on 31st August,was very happy with the staff all very helpfull and pleasant. When I booked I requested a room with double bed and no feathers in the room, which we got except that when we went to the room it was a twin. So I called reception and said that we had a twin and not a double. With no problem at all another room was perpared for us and because of inconveience they gave us free movies. We had a meal in the hotel not overly impressed but was ok, the spa facilities could be better and the pool a bit deeper.The breakfast was very good and enough of a choice and not cold which is sometimes the case for a buffet breakfast or you can order from the menu if you like. Would definatley recommed this hotel and its not too far away from the Avondale shopping centre.
reviews.title: Very Pleased with the stay

reviews.text: Was lovely to see the same faces still working in the mercure, staff rememberd us from our last visit and took the time to say hello and to ask if everything was ok with there service. Our freinds came to stay for the first time and they had a fantastic time and they hope to be back soon. Food was fantastic good choice. Hotel very clean as always. Special thank you to Denise, Graham and Mellisa for making our stay memerable and keeping the children amused. Keep up the good and hope to see you all soon.
reviews.title: overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for Edinburgh festival as this was by far a much cheaper option than staying in the city itself. Hotel is about a half hour train journey away from Edinburgh and a short taxi ride from hotel to train station. Bedroom was large and comfortable although a little on the hot side. Could so with some air con throughout. We ate in the hotel restaurant on saturday night. The food was delicious and the service was friendly and the young man that served us (David possibly the manager) couldnt have been more helpful. Garry at the bar he was just as pleasant. Only negative we could find is that the hotel could do with some modernisation on the decor but that is merely a personal preferance.
reviews.title: More than we expected

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night to take advantage of a girlie shopping trip.
reviews.title: Closest hotel to Livingston Shopping Mall and Designer Outlet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, the receptionist on duty was very pleasant, chatty and professional explained a little about the hotel and offered us a voucher for a complimentary glass of wine - very nice.
reviews.title: Never again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are, as some previous reviewers have said, a little dated. However, housekeeping is on the ball and the level of cleanliness is very high so no issue there. However, a huge issue with the bedroom was that the floor was sooooo creaky, there was hardly a space you could walk without creating a racket both for the people below and for each other during night time visits to the little girls' room!!!! Hotel desperately needs to address this issue - the odd floorboard is one thing, the whole room is quite another!.
reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service

reviews.text: We had a dinner inclusive deal. The menu had a reasonable choice for this package. However, the starter had to be sent back - staff very apologetic about this and starter replaced. Main course was very nice and we did not bother with dessert.
reviews.title: Brilliant Business Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a brilliant deal through Groupon for a 2night break. Checked in around 5pm, Melissa at reception was extremely helpful, I asked if there were any special deals if eating in the hotel, for an upfront fee of £15 we got to choose from the a la carte menu up to the value of £22 + a bottle of wine per couple! This was all thanks to Melissa who went out of her way to ensure we got the best value for our money. The hotel was very comfortable and our room was clean,well furnished and spacious.
reviews.title: Handy for the Capital

reviews.text: The breakfast each morning was delicious with a wide range of dishes available including some made to order. The staff in the bar and the dining room were very attentive and efficient.
reviews.title: 3 day coach trip

reviews.text: The hotel is very close to McArthur Glen shopping outlet and also has excellent links to the city of Edinburgh. Great value and I will be on the lookout for another deal.
reviews.title: customer comments

reviews.text: one of the quietest, nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff were pleasant and friendly. The rooms were comfortable, very clean and very quiet (no slamming doors), The food also was very good the breakfast being especially good, plenty of variety. A good hotel for visiting Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i recently stayed at this hotel as part of a national bus tour .the hotel itself was excellent and most of the staff were pleasant friendly and very helpful especially daniel and gary the 2 bar staff on duty during our stay . however there was one exception and this was agreed by everyone on the bus that david who we think was restaurant manager was surly unhelpful and abrupt in manner when speaking to customers he certainly lacks customer service skills i would have thought vital in this role
reviews.title: GOOD HOTEL CLOSE TO EDINBURGH
